snippet: Water covered most of Liberty Island during Hurricane Sandy, but never reached the Statue of Liberty’s base. Even so, it could be months before the site reopens.
abstract: About 75 percent of Liberty Island's 12 acres were underwater during Hurricane Sandy, but the Statue of Liberty was unharmed; National Park Service officials say the damage to the grounds will keep the island closed for some time.
lead_paragraph: Water covered most of Liberty Island during Hurricane Sandy, but never reached the Statue of Liberty’s base. Even so, it could be months before the site reopens.

headline.seo: Statue of Liberty Is Fine After Hurricane, but Liberty Island Isn’t
headline.main: Statue of Liberty Was Unscathed by Hurricane, but Its Home Took a Beating
headline.print_headline:
Lady Liberty
Is Just Fine;
Her Island
Is Battered
